name: jira
label: Jira
description: Jira Service Desk Connector for issue creating, updating and deleting.

fields.title: Server URL
fields.description: URL for the Jira server from where the connector gets notifications.
fields.name: server_url

fields.title: Username
fields.description: Username configured for your account to access the Jira server from where the connector gets notifications.
fields.name: username

fields.title: API Token
fields.description: API Token configured for your account to access the Jira server from where the connector gets notifications.
fields.name: token

fields.title: Verify SSL
fields.description: Specifies whether the SSL certificate for the server is to be verified or not. By default, this option is set to True.
fields.name: verify_ssl

operations.title: Create Ticket
operations.description: Creates a Jira ticket on your configured Jira server based on the project key, ticket summary, type, and description, and other input parameters you have specified.

parameters.title: Project Key
parameters.description: Specify the unique project ID that represents the project under which to create the Jira ticket.
parameters.name: project_key

parameters.title: Ticket Summary
parameters.description: Specify the summary or heading of the ticket to create on your configured Jira server.
parameters.name: ticket_summary

parameters.title: Ticket Description
parameters.description: Specify the description of the ticket to create on your configured Jira server.
parameters.name: ticket_description

parameters.title: Ticket Type
parameters.description: Specify the type of ticket to create on your configured Jira server.You can specify the following ticket types: IT Help, Service Request, Service Request with Approvals, Task, or Sub-task.
parameters.name: issue_type
parameters.tooltip: IT Help, Service Request, Service Request with Approvals, Task, Sub-task.

parameters.title: Parent Key ID
parameters.description: Specify the ID of the ticket under which to create subtask. This field is only needed when the ticket type is Subtask. For example DEMO-1.
parameters.name: parent
parameters.placeholder: The ID of the ticket under which you need to create subtask. This field is only needed when the ticket type is Subtask. e.g. DEMO-1
parameters.tooltip: The ID of the ticket under which you need to create subtask. This field is only needed when the ticket type is Subtask. e.g. DEMO-1

parameters.title: Priority
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the priority to set for the Jira ticket to update on your configured Jira server. You can specify one of the following priorities: Highest, High, Medium, Low, or Lowest.
parameters.name: priority

parameters.title: Other Fields
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify fields such as Reporter, Assignee, or Components to set while creating a ticket. For example: {"reporter": {"name":"admin"}, "assignee":{"name":"admin"}, "components":[{"name":"Intranet"}]}
parameters.name: other_fields
parameters.tooltip: Other fields can be Reporter, Assignee, Components etc.

operations.title: Get Ticket Details
operations.description: Retrieves details for a particular Jira ticket from the Jira server based on the ticket ID you have specified.

parameters.title: Ticket ID
parameters.description: Specify the unique ID associated with each ticket to retrieve from your configured Jira server. You can enter the ticket ID directly, such as JIR-000, or use dynamic variables in this field to enter the ticket ID in the Jinja format {{vars.result.data.key}}.
parameters.name: issue_key

operations.title: List Projects
operations.description: Retrieves a list and details of all projects from your configured Jira server.

operations.title: List Tickets
operations.description: Retrieves a list and details of tickets associated with a project from your configured Jira server, based on the project key and other input parameters you have specified.

parameters.title: JQL Query
parameters.description: Specify the Jira query to filter and list the tickets as per query parameters. You must specify at least one query parameter. For example, project = JIRA_PROJECT_ID.
parameters.toolbox: Check JQL syntax here https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftware/blog/2015/06/search-jira-like-a-boss-with-jql, minimum is: project = PROJECT_NAME
parameters.name: jql_query
parameters.tooltip: JQL Query. e.g. project = JIRA_PROJECT_ID and updatedDate < -1d

parameters.title: Start At
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the starting index for retrieving tickets from Jira. By default, this is set to 0.
parameters.name: startAt

parameters.title: Max Results
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the maximum number of tickets that this operation should return. By default, this is set to 50.
parameters.name: maxResults
parameters.tooltip: Maximum number of tickets to be fetch. Default is 50.

parameters.title: Fields
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify fields such as ID, Key, Status, Priority, and Reporter that you can choose to include and display in the output. For example: ["id","key","status","priority"]
parameters.name: fields
parameters.tooltip: Fields are different types of information in the system displayed in output e.g,id, Key, Status, Priority, Reporter. Provide in list.

operations.title: Validate JQL query
operations.description: Parses and validates JQL query syntax and returns errors when found.

parameters.title: JQL Query
parameters.description: Specify the Jira query to validate with the Jira Server. e.g. project = TIC and updatedDate < -1d
parameters.toolbox: You can use this action right before running List Tickets to avoid JQL syntax errors
parameters.name: jql_query
parameters.tooltip: JQL Query. e.g. project = TIC and updatedDate < -1d

operations.title: Search Users
operations.description: Returns a list of all users, including active users, inactive users and previously deleted users that have an Atlassian account.

parameters.title: Start At
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the starting index for retrieving tickets from Jira. By default, this is set to 0.
parameters.name: startAt

parameters.title: Max Results
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the maximum number of tickets that this operation should return. By default, this is set to 50.
parameters.name: maxResults
parameters.tooltip: Maximum number of users to be fetch. Default is 50.

operations.title: Get User Details
operations.description: Retrieves details for a particular Jira user from the Jira server based on the account ID you have specified.

parameters.title: Account ID
parameters.description: Specify the user's account ID. Account ID uniquely identifies the user across all Atlassian products and you can retrieve it from the Search Users action.
parameters.tooltip: The account ID of the user, which uniquely identifies the user across all Atlassian products, you can get it from Search Users. e.g. 5b10ac8d82e05b22cc7d4ef5
parameters.name: accountId

operations.title: Assign Issue to User
operations.description: Assigns an issue to a user based on the account and ticket ID that you have specified.

parameters.title: Account ID
parameters.description: Specify the assignee's account ID. Account ID uniquely identifies the user across all Atlassian products and you can retrieve it from the Search Users action. NOTE: To remove all assignees and mark the ticket unassigned, specify -1 in this field.
parameters.tooltip: The account ID of the assignee, if set to -1 the issue will be unassigned, You can get all users IDs via Search Users action. e.g. 5b10ac8d82e05b22cc7d4ef5
parameters.name: accountId

parameters.title: Ticket ID
parameters.description: Specify the unique ID associated with each ticket.
parameters.tooltip: Unique ID or key of the issue to be assigned. e.g. JIR-144
parameters.name: issue_key

operations.title: Add Attachment
operations.description: Attaches a file that is present in FortiSOAR to an existing Jira ticket on your configured Jira server based on the ticket ID and FortiSOAR file or attachment IRI you have specified.

parameters.title: Ticket ID
parameters.description: Specify the unique ID associated with each ticket to retrieve from your configured Jira server. You can enter the ticket ID directly, such as JIR-144, or use dynamic variables in this field to enter the ticket ID in the Jinja format {{vars.result.data.key}}.
parameters.name: issue_key

parameters.title: File or Attachment IRI

Attachment ID.title: Attachment ID
Attachment ID.description: Specify the attachment ID of the file in the FortiSOAR Attachments module.
Attachment ID.name: value

File IRI.title: File IRI
File IRI.description: Specify the File IRI of the file in the FortiSOAR Attachments module.
File IRI.name: value

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: Specify the file to add as an attachment to the specified Jira ticket. You can select from the following options: Attachment ID: Specify the attachment ID of the file in the FortiSOAR Attachments module. File IRI: Specify the File IRI of the file in the FortiSOAR Attachments module.

operations.title: Add Remote Link
operations.description: Adds a remote link of an issue to an existing ticket in Jira based on the ticket ID, URL, and title you have specified.

parameters.title: Ticket ID
parameters.description: Specify the unique ID associated with each ticket to retrieve from your configured Jira server. You can enter the ticket ID directly, such as JIR-144, or use dynamic variables in this field to enter the ticket ID in the Jinja format {{vars.result.data.key}}.
parameters.name: issue_key

parameters.title: URL
parameters.description: Specify the URL of the issue to add to the specified Jira ticket.
parameters.name: url
parameters.tooltip: URL of the ticket. e.g. http://www.mycompany.com/support?id=1

parameters.title: Title
parameters.description: Specify the title to add for the specified issue that you are adding to the Jira ticket.
parameters.name: title
parameters.tooltip: Title of the ticket. e.g. TSTSUP-111

operations.title: Add Comment
operations.description: Adds a comment to an existing Jira ticket on your configured Jira server based on the ticket ID and comment you have specified.

parameters.title: Ticket ID
parameters.description: Specify the unique ID associated with each ticket to retrieve from your configured Jira server. You can enter the ticket ID directly, such as JIR-144, or use dynamic variables in this field to enter the ticket ID in the Jinja format {{vars.result.data.key}}.
parameters.name: issue_key

parameters.title: Comment
parameters.description: Specify the comment to add to an existing Jira ticket.
parameters.name: comment

operations.title: Get Comments
operations.description: Retrieves a list of comments associated with an existing Jira ticket on your configured Jira server based on the ticket ID and other input parameters you have specified.

parameters.title: Ticket ID
parameters.description: Specify the unique ID associated with each ticket to retrieve from your configured Jira server. You can enter the ticket ID directly, such as JIR-144, or use dynamic variables in this field to enter the ticket ID in the Jinja format {{vars.result.data.key}}.
parameters.name: issue_key

parameters.title: Start At
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the starting index for retrieving tickets from Jira. By default, this is set to 0.
parameters.name: startAt

parameters.title: Max Results
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the maximum number of tickets that this operation should return. By default, this is set to 50.
parameters.name: maxResults
parameters.tooltip: Maximum number of tickets to be fetch. Default is 50.

parameters.title: OrderBy
parameters.description: Select the order in which to sort the tickets. You can select from the following options: Ascending or Descending
parameters.name: orderBy
parameters.tooltip: Field by which you want to sort the tickets.Possible values are Ascending or Descending.

operations.title: Set Ticket Status
operations.description: Updates the status of an existing Jira ticket on your configured Jira server based on the ticket ID and status you have specified.

parameters.title: Ticket ID
parameters.description: Specify the unique ID associated with each ticket to retrieve from your configured Jira server. You can enter the ticket ID directly, such as JIR-144, or use dynamic variables in this field to enter the ticket ID in the Jinja format {{vars.result.data.key}}.
parameters.name: issue_key

parameters.title: Status
parameters.description: Specify the status to set for an existing Jira ticket. You can add status such as To Do, In Progress, or Done.
parameters.name: status
parameters.tooltip: Ticket Status. e.g. To Do, In Progress, or Done.

operations.title: Update Ticket
operations.description: Updates an existing Jira ticket on your configured Jira server based on the project key, ticket ID and other input parameters you have specified.

parameters.title: Ticket ID
parameters.description: Specify the unique ID associated with each ticket to retrieve from your configured Jira server. You can enter the ticket ID directly, such as JIR-144, or use dynamic variables in this field to enter the ticket ID in the Jinja format {{vars.result.data.key}}.
parameters.name: issue_key

parameters.title: Project Key
parameters.description: Specify the unique project ID that represents the project under which to update the Jira ticket.
parameters.name: project_key

parameters.title: Summary
parameters.description: Specify the summary or heading of the ticket to update on your configured Jira server.
parameters.name: summary

parameters.title: Comment
parameters.description: Specify the comment to add to an existing Jira ticket.
parameters.name: comment

parameters.title: Priority
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the priority to update for the Jira ticket. You can specify one of the following priorities: Highest, High, Medium, Low, or Lowest.
parameters.name: priority
parameters.tooltip: Ticket Priority. e.g. Highest, High, Medium, Low, Lowest

parameters.title: Description
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the description to add to the Jira ticket when you are updating it on your configured Jira server.
parameters.name: description

parameters.title: Status
parameters.description: Specify the status to set for an existing Jira ticket. You can add status such as To Do, In Progress, or Done.
parameters.name: status
parameters.tooltip: Ticket Status. e.g. To Do, In Progress, or Done.

parameters.title: Other Fields
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify fields such as Reporter, Assignee, or Components to set while updating the ticket. For example: {"reporter": {"name":"admin"}, "assignee":{"name":"admin"}, "components":[{"name":"Intranet"}]}
parameters.name: other_fields
parameters.tooltip: Other fields can be Components,Reporter,Assignee etc which needs to be updated.

operations.title: Update FortiSOAR Record
operations.description: Updates a FortiSOAR record with information on an existing Jira ticket based on the ticket ID and other input parameters you have specified.

parameters.title: Ticket ID
parameters.description: Specify the unique ID associated with each ticket to retrieve from your configured Jira server. You can enter the ticket ID directly, such as JIR-144, or use dynamic variables in this field to enter the ticket ID in the Jinja format {{vars.result.data.key}}.
parameters.name: jira_key

parameters.title: FortiSOAR Username
parameters.description: Specify the username of the FortiSOAR instance where you want to update the Jira ticket.
parameters.name: cyops_username

parameters.title: FortiSOAR Password
parameters.description: Specify the password of the FortiSOAR instance where you want to update the Jira ticket.
parameters.name: cyops_password

operations.title: Delete Ticket
operations.description: Deletes a ticket from your configured Jira server based on the ticket ID and other input parameters you have specified.

parameters.title: Ticket ID
parameters.description: Specify the unique ID associated with each ticket to retrieve from your configured Jira server. You can enter the ticket ID directly, such as JIR-144, or use dynamic variables in this field to enter the ticket ID in the Jinja format {{vars.result.data.key}}.
parameters.name: issue_key

parameters.title: Delete Subtasks
parameters.description: Select this option, i.e., set it to true to delete subtasks associated with the Jira ticket. If the ticket has subtasks then you must select this option to successfully delete the ticket from your configured Jira server.
parameters.name: delete_subtask
parameters.tooltip: If the ticket has subtasks you must set the parameter Delete Subtasks=true to delete the ticket.
